cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to accelerate NNE, cross Florida’s Big Bend Thursday night, then sweep northeastward across GA/SC/NC and move offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast toward New Jersey by late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Apalachicola/Suwannee River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland FL to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Suwannee River FL to Mexico Beach FL (Hurricane); Anclote River to Suwannee River FL and West of Mexico Beach to Destin FL (Tropical Storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of FL, then GA/SC/NC coasts, reaching the Mid-Atlantic (VA–NJ) late weekend
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (generally 1–2 ft possible along DE Bay/coast)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds 30–45 mph possible late Sunday into early Monday; low (18 %) chance of sustained tropical-storm force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water-level rises of 1–2 ft in Delaware Bay with onshore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain Sunday–Monday with localized totals near 4 inches and urban/river flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk cannot be ruled out in outer rain bands; elevated seas and dangerous rip currents along Delaware beaches
